neighbors.name: Meshell D. Shepherd & Jason L. Shepherd
neighbors.claims: Meshell D. Shepherd and Jason L. Shepherd are listed as co-owners of Cochise County parcel 106-06-025C according to county property records ([parcelinquirytreasurer.cochise.az.gov](https://parcelinquirytreasurer.cochise.az.gov/Main/ParcelEntry)). Public records indicate Meshell D. Shepherd is a long-time resident associated with the property ([elementix.ai](https://elementix.ai/investors/az/meshell-shepherd)), while Jason L. Shepherd shares the address ([simplecontacts.com](https://www.simplecontacts.com/profile/Susan-Owens-1cef2634)). No evidence was found of the Shepherds’ participation in local government meetings or public development debates.
neighbors.influence_justification: No public roles or civic leadership positions identified; likely private citizens.

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate a personal, neighborly introduction to build rapport. Since they have no known public stance, emphasize transparency about the project and invite them to share any questions or concerns regarding privacy or property impacts.

neighbors.name: Gale Nellans
neighbors.claims: Gale Nellans is the owner of parcel 106-15-013C in Cochise County and resides in Tucson, AZ ([www.mishlerfhcc.com](https://www.mishlerfhcc.com/obituaries/miles-nellans)). He is identified in family records as the brother of the late Miles Nellans ([www.mishlerfhcc.com](https://www.mishlerfhcc.com/obituaries/miles-nellans)). No recorded presence in Cochise County’s local civic events or media related to development issues was found, indicating an absence of a public stance.
neighbors.influence_justification: Absentee owner residing in Tucson; no local civic footprint found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Since Nellans is an absentee owner residing in Tucson, reach out via mail or email with clear project information. Focus on property value protection and the passive nature of the development, as he is not locally active.

citations.claim: Gale Nellans is the owner of parcel 106-15-013C in Cochise County and resides in Tucson, AZ
citations.title: Obituary for Miles Nellans (listing survivor Gale Nellans of Tucson)

neighbors.name: Darrel D. Howell & Lee Ann Howell
neighbors.claims: Darrel D. Howell and Lee Ann Howell are listed owners of Cochise County parcel 106-03-039E ([parcelinquirytreasurer.cochise.az.gov](https://parcelinquirytreasurer.cochise.az.gov/Main/ParcelEntry)). Lee Ann Howell is a prominent local educator, serving as a science teacher at Colonel Smith Middle School in Fort Huachuca ([sarsef.org](https://sarsef.org/author/nickwpadmin/)) and was recognized as the 2018 Cochise County Teacher of the Year ([cochiseeducationfoundation.org](https://cochiseeducationfoundation.org/recognition/)). Darrel Howell is employed by the U.S. Forest Service as a forestry technician and firefighter, having worked in the Nogales and Sierra Vista Ranger Districts ([fs.usda.gov](https://www.fs.usda.gov/sopa/components/reports/sopa-110305-2024-01.pdf)). Despite their public service roles, no explicit public stance on commercial renewable energy development was found.
neighbors.influence_justification: Lee Ann is a former County Teacher of the Year; Darrel is a USFS official.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with deference to their public service roles. Given Lee Ann's science background and Darrel's forestry work, be prepared to discuss environmental impacts (habitat, runoff) in technical detail. Acknowledge their community contributions to build trust.
